12.76.text:
00:12
COMM: The Colima Volcano in Mexico is one

15.27.text:
of the most active volcanoes on the North
American continent. With more than 40 eruptions

22.24.text:
00:24
COMM: Marc Szeglat has travelled the world

26.29.text:
filming volcanoes for the last 20 years, and
has arrived to film the latest eruption

33.51.text:
00:36
COMM: Day and night dramatic clouds of ash

38.84.text:
rise into the air, and occasionally flashes
of volcanic lightning appear in the ash cloud.

44.79.text:
00:47
COMM: The volcano has been constantly active

49.99.text:
since 2001 and is permanently monitored by
the University of Colima.

54.77.text:
00:55
COMM: And while a large eruption might not

57.74.text:
threaten any major metropolitan areas, the
surrounding countryside is still densely populated

67.60.text:
01:08
COMM: And if the danger of eruption wasn’t

70.91.text:
enough, there is also the risk of Lahar, mudflows
caused by heavy rainfall mixing with volcanic

76.89.text:
ash, powerful enough to destroy bridges and
roads in the vicinity of the volcano.
